very good quiet authentic Thai food off the strip. Very friendly staff. Seemed like they know a lot of their repeat customers. The spices were good. I highly recommend this place as a change of pace from the usual Strip food. Not the safest of neighborhoods. Just be wary of your environment and lock your door. Good parking near the restaurant. That is safe. Just be wary if you want to stroll around the block. that's all.

I work nearby and have had their Chicken Panang Curry, Spicy Egg plant and beef jerky all were very good the prices are reasonable and when ordering through yelp using Eat24 delivery option (another great service)  Placing my order online with comments and specifics is a snap then I keep working until the yummy food arrives!  
:-)

Not worth the price at all
Over priced bad quality of food
Ordered fried rice and sweet and sour pork for delivery which totaled 30$ before tip
The food was nothing more than ok as far as the taste, but wreaked havoc on both mine and my gf stomachs so I'm assuming it wasn't fresh
If I could give no stars I would
Never going to order from there again, nor will I recommend it to anyone else

Not a fan of the karaoke on the weekends, but the food at this place rocks. 

Yum.

Nothing beats late night cheap food in Vegas. They deliver until 6AM (right to your hotel too)!! And they open again at 11 AM! Food quality / taste is one thing, but they definitely deserve a 4-star for opening and delivering late. Save their # in your cell phone as you would for a promoter's # when you go to Vegas. It'll come in handy on one of the nights, trust me.

Excellent food...We had the Thai dumplings which is similar to the Chinese siu mai, however the ingredients were different so the flavor was great. The larb salad was good. We loved the sea bass on a bed of  broccoli. The sea bass was perfectly crispy on the outside and tender and melts in your mouth with each bite. It was in a sauce which had a slight curry and sweet taste with a fine kick!. Service was superb with great explanation of each food and generous with their charge for the fish. The pieces of fish were smaller so they charged accordingly.Very fair!

Live nearby and order from this place about once per month. The yellow curry & pad se eew always comes tasting great-- one of my favorites in town. Delivery is quick, and the driver never has a problem finding my place. Great restaurant for take out.

I appreciate that this is open late for swing shift people like us to be able to grab eats. I haven't gotten bad service or food here, but some of the previous reviews are a put off. I havent ever bought my water but then again I usually ask for a Thai Ice Tea first and they give me a complimentary glass....I guess they don't want to give anything "free" to drink. Been here quite a few times over the past two years, last visit was a few months ago. 

I particularly like their beef jerky here, its always nicely marinated and flavored. Massaman here was good though my BF likes their panang style curry better. I like their Pad See Ew here. Have had a few dishes, but their menu is fairly big so havent made much of a dent. 

Portions are okay sized though its priced a bit higher than most Thai places. Not ridiculously so, but still noticeable. Service even though we are one of maybe 2-3 late night people or even sometimes the only late night diners can be hit and miss. There are times they check on us often and such then there are times they are somewhere... 

It is a decent spot for late night hungries like us and I can't knock em for making beef jerky the way it should be. I appreciate too that it's quiet here as most late night Thai tend to want to be a kareoke/bar/restaurant at night.

Hands down best Thai massage ever! These gals have strong hands and great technique. Perfect combo of stretching, deep tissue and and they walk on your back! Will definitely be back...now for some Thai food down the street.
The food's ok but the lunch special through 3 pm on weekdays is an excellent deal.

Can honestly say I was surprised big time! Driven by a number of times and never once thought to stop. Thanks to Yelp and getting out of work late, decided to stop in and get some takeout.
Was a bit skeptical when we pulled up as the place is pretty dull and there were zero cars in front. Almost thought they were closed. Walked in and it is a nice size place with very outdated furniture and decor. Only one couple was sat down to eat (at almost 7pm that was a bit worrisome to me). They had a nice menu with your typical Thai fare. Pricing was about average for Thai food, a bit pricey to me for the look of the place. I wasn't feeling very bold, so I stuck to the basics and ordered chicken fried rice (one of my favorite dishes and a good judge for me of whether the place is worth coming back to). Kacey ordered the Chicken Pad See-Eew. At $9 for each dish, it was a pretty decent size portion.
My fried rice was one of the best I've had in Vegas, especially once I added a little bit of soy sauce. Wow! I ate the entire portion and was still craving more. I did wish it had a bit more chicken, but that may just be me being greedy. Kacey seemed to really enjoy her dish as well and had no complaints.
Needs major updating in the restaurant and I honestly am not sure how they stay in business if they only had once couple in that big restaurant during dinner hours. But they gained a new customer and we will be back soon to try more! Will stick to take-out though as I don't think I would enjoy my meal sitting in that dining room.
Love this place my go to for yelp eats delivery. Have Never had a bad meal. Always delivers earlier than expected, hot and food quality is excellent!!!

I've never eaten here, but when I was working until 11 pm it was a godsend to quench my pad thai and thai iced tea thirst. Restaurant definitely leaves something to be desired as far as decor, but if you've eaten at an older china town establishment, you'll be able to eat here. Service is friendly and quick. After the second time I ordered, the staff was well acquainted with what I wanted, who I was, and I was welcomed personally. That can be a nice thing or maybe a hint you need to cook more at home. Dishes are reasonably priced and they give you quite a bit of food. If you're in the area or even headed home from work, I can't recommend this place more.

Coming from California, i was in desperate need of a GO TO thai restaurant, and after trying 
out many Thai places, I finally found the one! This place is amazing for the price, offers delivery, grub hub, and the customer service is spot on. couldn't give em anything less than 5 stars ! everyone is so so friendly and open and the food leaves me full and content everytime. I get something new everytime and have never been disappointed.

This is now my favorite Thai spot in town!

Everything is delicious, but the spicy mint chicken (pad kapao) is my choice in town, and I have ordered it in every place I go.  Also, their drunken noodles (pad kee mao) is my fav in town as well.  They have a nice varient with crab meat that is super sweet and spicy at the same time!  Mouth is watering as I write!

We have also tried some curry dishes and a few others, and they all have been delicious.  Good thai tea...Nothing bad here so far...truth!

The waitress is very friendly and so is the rest of the staff.  

Give it a try and see for yourself...this might be your new Thai restaurant :)

We were on our way to Utah and decided to make a stop at this restaurant for dinner. We all shared a few dishes including the Egg rolls, Curry, Pad Thai, Tom Yum soup and I had a Thai tea as a beverage. Within a couple minutes of walking out of this restaurant I experienced severe stomach cramping to the point I was screaming in pain. We had to pull over and I began to violently vomit in a bag while crying in pain for almost 45 minutes. I seriously considered going to the ER. No one else in our group was affected from the food we shared, leaving me to think that there was something wrong with my Thai tea I consumed. I am a big fan of Thai food and eat it regularly at other places back home and have never had this type of reaction. I find what happened HIGHLY SUSPICIOUS . ... and would NOT recommend this place to anyone.

The Pad Thai here is addicting! It's a really great dish here. However, the portions are very small. They use thinner noodles than most pad thais use. Their green curry is also very good but the meat is a tad on the dry side. The papaya salad was just alright though, the portion was very very small. I've been here two times and haven't been disappointed. Our server lady was very pleasant.

Hole in the wall. This place is BOMB ! 
Shrimp soup was bomb , tempura shrimp, cashew , etc. definitely coming back !

This is always a great place for some thai as a backup.  My wife and I have been going here about once every 2-3 months for the last 5 years.  They've gone through a little bit of inconsistencies in food quality in the past, but in the last year or so it's been pretty good.

LOVE the yellow curry chicken.

The food was great and the service was even better!  Pork Larb was fresh, Chicken Curry was flavorful yet light, and the Chinese Broccoli w/ Mushrooms was delicious and healthy.  We came in late and were probably the last guests, but our server was still so sweet and attentive.

Always delicious.  We order from Krung Thai to our work atleAst 3 times a week. Panang curry with tofu and pad see ew with tofu no egg!  If you haven't been there I definitely recommend it. Just watch out for the spicy  levels. Sometimes it's a little hot!

Very mediocre and overpriced Thai cuisine, in my opinion. Tried it because my friend lives near-by and because I'm always game for trying a new Thai place! I love 

Thai cuisine and have a few staples that I order at every new place I try to see how these compare--well Krung Thai fell right in the average range. Tom Kha Kai soup was tasty, but duck dish seemed heated in a microwave, was unusually greasy and even a bit cold on edges. Unacceptable. Other tried meat dishes were nothing spectacular, just edible. 

I did enjoy the "cheesy, hole-in-a-wall" atmosphere and service was timely, but not spectacular by any means. Had to wait for my water to be refilled once for quite a while...

The worst part about this restaurant are the prices. I found most to be overpriced, especially since portion sizes are rather small. I also did not like the "fast-food-like" menus with pictures. I thought that too many "Chinese-inspired" foods were offered, and not enough Thai dishes were present. 

I may come back here to try it again since my friend lives near-by, but only for this reason. I would not recommend this place unless you are in the general vicinity and don' t mind paying top dollar for mediocre food.
Great thai spot for late night dining.close to the strip.not expensive.the thai karioke is very funny.
I just love the lunch special and the staff is very nice!!! The pad thai shrimp and thai ice coffee extra milk was so delicious we will definitely come back again.
Love this place! Food is fresh, staff is friendly and its always easy to get a table.

This review is based on my most recent visit (February 13, 2016). 
I first came here in July, 2014, right after they opened I believe. Scant d√©cor, basically just some tables and chairs, and my Mom and I had a fantastic dinner. I came back several times with visiting friends and locals between then and September, 2015. I saw the banquettes go in, the stage added, etc. Each time my friends were thoroughly delighted with the food, and I loved the Pad Thai. It was kind of funny that the drinks were out of a can, and that one guy was the host(ess), server, and cashier for the entire restaurant, but the food was 5 star all the way. 
Fast forward to my February visit, an early Valentines with my out of town love. Admittedly, it was 5 months since my last visit. I don't know what happened, maybe the chef got hired away, or called in sick? IDK, but my Pad Thai was awful, and yellow!?! My love's dish was also worthless. Neither of us ate, but we didn't have the heart to challenge the server who as usual was wearing all the hats and seemed very busy even though there were very few customers.
Maybe it was just a bad, correction: very bad night. But I am reluctant to go back again after having been so disappointed, not to mention embarrassed that I really gushed about this restaurant in advance.

Another note worthy Thai restaurant, food is very tasty and the prices are fair.


"Rub a dub dub!"

Best fried rice and pad see ew. Oh and the Thai ice tea is refreshing on a hot summer night. 

What I really liked was also the live music playing in the background.  Good atmosphere, good food, good music makes for a good night. 

Will love to be back.
I have never done take out on Yelp but for the first one I am so please. Perfectly spicy, great food, and quick delivery. If I could add an extra tip after the fact, I certainly would.

The food tasted amazing but 1 hour into the trip home both my daughter and I started developing very clear signs of food poisoning! Bleh. My husband had a small bout and mine was over in a day but my daughter suffered for 3 days. Straight to a one star for this one. My poor baby. 
I tipped a good 25% on our order and the service was great buuuut... I'll try to recreate this taste at home because no way will I risk this again.
I really wanted to love this place because the food tasted so good :(

This place is so awesome. the food is sooo delicious. i just ordered food from this place and i know for sure the main ingredient to every dish was love. my taste buds died and went to heaven every time i took a bite. I bet whoever makes this food cries every time a dish leaves the kitchen because they care about their food so much. I tasted the love and it is delicious. it was so fresh and they got to my house so quickly. its like they were waiting for me to call. I have also gone to this restaurant and it is so cute and cozy and the ladies who work there are so sweet and nice. please eat here. it will make your soul happy.

I can't believe it took me over a year to try this place since its so close to my apartment.  I've managed to go there 4 times in the last month!  Good stuff.  Just a warning to you all...level 5 spice is nothing to mess with...the tom yum gun soup was ridiculously hot!!!!

My wife always goes with one of the shrimp curries.  I've gone all noodle with everything being awesome.  

I would imagine karaoke would be pretty fun(ny) here.

I absolutely love this place. I remember each and every time I have come here because the food is always delicious and they are beyond friendly. They have to be the nicest people at a restaurant I have ever met and that's them every single time I go so I know it's just a nice place. Definitely recommend the Pad Se Ew and the crab fried rice together.

In this corner of Las Vegas is a nicely spaced thai restaurant with food you can definitely get a good munch on.

They have mango sticky rice that could have better presentation but none the less taste great. They have a stage i guess for karaoke or for a band so this definitely jumps when it it's in the evening. Yeah definitely worth comjng back.

Especially for the nice cgopped pieces of steak.

Would have liked to given this 3.5 stars, but settled on 3. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't great. I will still come back when I'm in the mood for thai. The yellow curry was spicy, but wasn't packed with flavor. Slightly more soupy than I like and the potatoes were a little too undercooked.

This place is off the hook good!  We've visited many times and every single time, everything we order is awesome.  Their soups are great, the salads are awesome.  Pad Thai noodle is perfect, curries are great.  This is one excellent place to visit if you are craving good thai food in Vegas.

My boyfriend And I were looking for a good Thai place and found this on Yelp. The food is clean, organic, and delicious! We didn't feel sluggish or tired, we felt great and we'll definitely come back for another grubbin!
pretty tasty Pad Thai and Pad Se Ew.  Wait staff were very friendly and attentive!  Prices were spot on too

My coworkers and I LOVE this place. We go here at least once a week. They have the best lunch specials in the area, delicious and affordable. Our favorites are the mint chili chicken or the pad thai. They have delicious thai tea.  

During lunch hour it doesn't get too busy and the service is always great. 

I believe they have a live band some nights. I've never been but I wouldn't doubt it's great. 

Highly recommend this place if you like thai for a great price with great service.

When we were vacationing in Vegas four years ago, we stopped by here and ordered takeout.  Everything was delicious.  On a recent trip with family, I decided to dine here again.  Place was half crowded around 7pm but they only had one server so she was running around a bit.  My sister always ordered the squid salad and used this dish to compare and contrast with other Thai restaurants.  We agreed that it was decent but another place nearby prepared it much better.  I ordered the shrimp in clear vermicelli noodle.  It was ok.  I don't know maybe we've eaten at so many Thai restaurants lately our taste have become refined.  In any case, I'd rate this place 7/10 on taste alone.  Pricing is on par with nearby restaurants.

Krung Thai is probably one of the best Thai restaurants in Las Vegas. The food is good and pretty authentic. They even serve roti for dessert (okay, so that's really Indian, but you can find it everywhere in Bangkok). 

The atmosphere is okay. The place is decently decorated, there is a dance floor (but I've never seen anyone dancing), and there is live music (English and Thai) almost every night. I don't go here for the d√©cor though; it's for the food. 

I can't get enough of their chicken/eggplant dish. Yummy.

pretty good... shrimp fried rice was excellent, nice wok-y onion flavor, n very good red penang curry. one of the best red currys ive had. i would like to try more to see if i can give them more stars!

their business is super slow during lunch, but service is fast... cant wait to go back for dinner. but i will be prepared to pay. i do think it is a little expensive... for shrimp fried rice and penang chicken curry & 1 thai iced coffee the bill came to $26, so i left $30.

i have been to lotus of siam which is like sooooo popular here, but i think that place is over rated. ya the food is good, but when i eat there im on the toilet half the night with a sour tummy sooooo that tells me theyre not very clean.

this place on the other hand... no tummy aches :) 
price sucks, food is good. its satisfying.

Yummy, yummy, yummy, I've got pad thai in my tummy. 

Excellent service, PHANtastic pad thai (see what I did there?), I loved the thai tea, and got out hot noodley awesomeness in about 7 minutes from ordering. I shalllllllll return.

One of the best Thai restaurants that we have ever tried.

Current favorites include:
- Duck Fried Rice .. sooooo delicious
- Duck Salad
- Duck with Basil (Is there a pattern here?)
- Panang style chicken Curry 
- Massaman style Chicken curry

Granted, we haven't tried the majority of the dishes that they serve, but we've definitely enjoyed everything that we have tried so far.

The staff has been very very friendly every time that we have visited them, sure, that's what Thai folks are known for, their friendliness, but these guys are even friendlier than most.  A definite must-try.

Edit - After a recent re-visitand the great experience we had there with the incredibly friendly staff and the consistently great food I decided to bump up my rating to 4.5*

I got the pad kee mao and my noodles were a little hard and bland. My friend got pad thai style noodles with crab on top, and his noodles were delicious. Service was friendly albeit slow considering we were the only party there...

Ordered carry out and was a little disappointed I had to wait longer than the wait time I was given and it was pretty empty in there too. The restaurant is extremely outdated and definitely needs a make over. They have a band and a small dance area, not sure if people really use it, but I thought it was funny how the two guys up there kept encouraging customers to come up and sing karaoke. 

The food was good, but a little spicy for my family who have no tolerance for spicy food. I had specifically requested for not spicy on all the entrees, and cilantro was added to my tom yung koong against my wishes (my sister is allergic). Staff was very nice though and apologized for the longer wait time.

Standard Thai Fare, nice service and food. 

Krung Thai isn't much to look at from outside. It looks vacant and dark. Kinda looks the same from the inside. The service is friendly and helpful. We ordered the pork pad thai and yellow curry with chicken. Both were satisfying and had just the right amount of spice. The thai tea is subtle and not too sweet. Just the way I like it.

As many other Yelpers have said in previous reviews, the prices are only slightly higher than most other Thai restaurants in town. Nothing too horrible, but noticeable. I wish they were a little more generous with the rice. They give  you a very small scoop to go with your dish. I like rice, and lots of it.

Very happy with the food here, just a few upgrades and it would definitely be a 4 star review all the way. I can never resist Thai food. I look forward to trying more dishes here, especially their soups, noodles and curries.

This is low key a really great restaurant if there interior was redesigned. It just reminds me of grandma's home with flamboyant decors. And sometimes, on the dance floor parks a bike. Uhm, what?! Now you might be wondering what's going on here? Why would you come back time and time again for food there? Because it's freaking delicious. 

My go-to meal is the chicken yellow curry that never seizes to disappoint. At $6.99, this lunch special is the most amazing. Potatoes are always cooked just right and the carrots too. But the best part for me is the curry sauce. It's sweet and salt with a hint of spice that I can never get tired of! Ever. Pair it with a side of rice and you're in for a treat. 

I'm also a great fan of there tom ka kai and pineapple fried rice. I always get the two together because that's the ultimate pair! Seriously, consider trying it. I tastes homemade like what mama would cook after a long day. Salute to that meal.
